member.name: IMFAsyncCallback.GetParameters
member.summary: Provides configuration information to the dispatching thread for a callback.

param.name: pdwFlags
param.para: Receives a flag indicating the behavior of the callback object's method. The following values are defined. The default value is zero.

listheader.description: The callback does not take a long time to complete, but has no specific restrictions on what system calls it makes. The callback generally takes less than 30 milliseconds to complete.

The callback does very minimal processing. It takes less than 1 millisecond to complete.
The callback must be invoked from one of the following work queues:
MFASYNC_CALLBACK_QUEUE_IO
MFASYNC_CALLBACK_QUEUE_TIMER

Implies MFASYNC_FAST_IO_PROCESSING_CALLBACK, with the additional restriction that the callback does no processing (less than 50 microseconds), and the only system call it makes is SetEvent.
The callback must be invoked from one of the following work queues:
MFASYNC_CALLBACK_QUEUE_IO
MFASYNC_CALLBACK_QUEUE_TIMER

param.name: pdwQueue
param.para: Receives the identifier of the work queue on which the callback is dispatched.

This value can specify one of the standard Media Foundation work queues, or a work queue created by the application. For list of standard Media Foundation work queues, see Work Queue Identifiers. To create a new work queue, call . The default value is MFASYNC_CALLBACK_QUEUE_STANDARD.
If the work queue is not compatible with the value returned in pdwFlags, the Media Foundation platform returns MF_E_INVALID_WORKQUEUE when it tries to dispatch the callback. (See .)

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: Not implemented. Assume the default behavior.

member.name: IMFAsyncCallback.Invoke
member.summary: Called when an asynchronous operation is completed.
member.param: Pointer to the interface. Pass this pointer to the asynchronous End... method to complete the asynchronous call.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

member.name: IMFAsyncCallback
member.summary: Callback interface to notify the application when an asynchronous method completes.
